intro: Bryanthus gmelinii, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing herbaceous plant characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of Eurasia, it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in dry, open habitats such as dunes and steppes. Its adaptations to harsh environments include reduced leaf size and efficient water storage mechanisms.
